comments:
3.2 RC3

Sometimes, when terminating a target with thread groups on, I get this in the log.

It seems to happen sometimes when terminating a target with thread groups
showning. As well, I get this sometimes:

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException[5010]:
com.sun.jdi.VMDisconnectedException: Got IOException from Virtual Machine
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketSendManager.sendPacket(PacketSendManager.java:80)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:170)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:192)
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:207)
        at
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ThreadReferenceImpl.threadGroup(ThreadReferenceImpl.java:454)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread.getUnderlyingThreadGroup(JDIThread.java:1612)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread.getThreadGroup(JDIThread.java:2510)
        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.threadgroups.JavaThreadEventHandler.addPathToThread(JavaThreadEventHandler.java:53)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.ThreadEventHandler.fireDeltaAndClearTopFrame(ThreadEventHandler.java:161)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.ThreadEventHandler.handleTerminate(ThreadEventHandler.java:109)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.EventHandlerModelProxy.dispatchTerminate(EventHandlerModelProxy.java:179)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.EventHandlerModelProxy.handleDebugEvents(EventHandlerModelProxy.java:135)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.run(DebugPlugin.java:1076)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.dispatch(DebugPlugin.java:1108)
        at
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventDispatchJob.run(DebugPlugin.java:344)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Fixed in JDIThread. Ignore/consume disconnect and collected exceptions - it indicates the thread no longer exists. In this case we return a "null" thread group.

I have never seen nor been able to reproduce this problem, but the fix looks valid.

verified
